intro: Sabatia campestris f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered sandplain bluet, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sandy soils, often in disturbed areas or along roadsides. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The subspecies albiflora is distinguished by its notably lighter flower color compared to the typical form of Sabatia campestris.
